content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)  
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –49.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)  
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –47.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)  
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)  
  • Pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –44.5)  
– Belt Group connecting the fast inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)  
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) connected to the boiler  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)  
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (2.5, 27.5) 
  • Note: The fluid pipeline from the Boiler to the Steam Engine remains unresolved due to congestion near (2.5, 21.5)

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Electricity network established through Small Electric Poles distributed over the area

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups distributed across the map (e.g., around (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), etc.)  
– A key Pipe Group links the new Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)  
– A problematic connection near (2.5, 21.5) blocks the fluid pipeline to the Steam Engine

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking outputs of mining and inserter setups  
– An electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution links

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion Issues
  – The fluid pipeline between the Boiler (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine (2.5, 27.5) remains unresolved due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5).  
  – Mitigate by reconfiguring or relocating obstructing pipe groups, employing underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and rerouting the connection to a less congested area.

• Fuel and Resource Provisioning
  – Multiple entities (e.g., Burner Mining Drill, Burner Inserter, Furnace) report warnings such as “out of fuel” or “no ingredients to smelt.”  
  – Ensure sufficient fuel supplies and verify that necessary resource inputs are available ahead of placement attempts.

• Electrical Connectivity Concerns
  – Warnings like “not receiving electricity” and “not connected to power network” affect Fast Inserter and Assembling Machine operations.  
  – Confirm that all electrical components are properly linked to a functioning power network during setup.

• Placement and Inventory Verification
  – Messages regarding missing resources (e.g., insufficient iron-plate for pipe creation) indicate lapses in verifying placement conditions.  
  – Always check that target areas are unobstructed and that the inventory holds necessary resources before positioning entities.
